topic.title: Using Synopsys Bridge CLI with Black Duck

body.p: Black Duck is a software composition analysis (SCA) security scanning tool that helps manage the security, quality, and license compliance risks of Open Source and third-party code in applications and containers. Running a Black Duck scan alerts you to vulnerabilities in these Open Source and third party tools and their libraries.
If you have integrated the GitHub Actions or GitLab Template Adapters, scans can be automatically run for pulls or pushes in the background, with the adapter levering Synopsys Bridge.
You can also run Black Duck scans using Synopsys Bridge command line calls.

p.note: To enable automatic creation of pull requests to fix the vulnerability found, set blackduck.automation.fixpr to true. This only works for npm (Node.js) scans, and only for direct dependencies. Users still have to approve pull requests through their usual process.

section.title: Running Black Duck scans with a JSON file
section.p: You can invoke a JSON file from your project root directory containing common arguments to run scans.

After setting your access token as an environmental variable (BRIDGE_BLACKDUCK_TOKEN), here's an example command loading the input.json file:synopsys-bridge --stage blackduck --input input.json --verbose

section.title: Running Black Duck scans on the command line
section.p: Instead of using a JSON file, you can pass all arguments on the command line. The JSON example above is the same as passing the following arguments written out on the command line:export BRIDGE_BLACKDUCK_TOKEN=<BLACKDUCK_TOKEN> synopsys-bridge --stage blackduck \ blackduck.url=<BLACKDUCK_URL> \ blackduck.scan.failure.severities='["CRITICAL"]' \ --verbose
BRIDGE_BLACKDUCK_TOKEN indicates the token is passed as an environmental variable.

synopsys-bridge indicates you're running the Synopsys Bridge CLI. The --stage flag specifies a group of adapters to run. Each adapter has a stage assigned in its configuration. More complex use cases require a few more arguments.
blackduck.scan.failure.severities indicates what level of problem breaks the build.
--verbose sets logs to verbose mode, recording additional information that can be useful for debugging or understanding why you may not be getting expected results.

You can run Black Duck scans as either Full (intelligent) or Rapid. When invoking Black Duck from Bridge, the default scan type is Rapid. To carry out a Full scan, you must setblackduck.scan.full as true.

You can set any resource known to Synopsys Bridge as a command line argument. Simply provide the entire namespace of the resource and its corresponding value in the format key=value. The command example above sets the project.name resource to the value central-scm-proj, loads the proper adapters to run scans with, and lists the proper scanning server URL.
For more details, see the Complete List of Synopsys Bridge Arguments.
